data.text:
Deliverables

D4.4.1 All Models of Key Cognitive Processes developed during SGA2

Presentation of all models developed by WP4.4 during the SGA2, including: functions and performance, validation (by SP4, by rest of the HBP and/or by third parties), how results compare to targeted impact, and links to models and related datasets in publicly accessible online repositories.

D2.4.1 Software tool for brain structure - phenotype associations

Software tool for brain structure - phenotype associations implemented (T2.4.2); software available for usage

D9.1.1 Working prototype of a Collaboratory app for graphical model building

Collaboratory app usable by an SP9 member outside the developer team

D5.6.1 Interactive classifier training via the new Viewer

Users can train machine learning algorithms interactively by giving annotations in the web-based Viewer (T5.6.1)

D2.6.1 Tool for Morphological classification of neurons

Tool for Morphological classification of neurons (T2.6.4) made available; storage of software on HBP Collab

D5.3.1 New release of interactive spatial alignment tool

We will deploy the 2nd release of the interactive spatial alignment tool started in SGA1. The release will provide a significantly streamlined user interface, especially a much better user experience in terms of landmark management and interactive navigation. (T5.3.3)

D7.3.1 Multi-compartment benchmark and validation suites on HPC systems

The validation and benchmark suites for multi- compartment simulators are deployed and their associated documentation can be downloaded from public repositories; the continuous integration framework is publishing up to date validation and benchmark results from HPC systems used in the HBP.

D9.5.1 Temporal filtering network

Network for temporal filtering running on SpiNNaker (Task 9.5.1)

D2.3.1 Alignment strategy of datasets from TPFM, 3D-PLI, and dMRI

Alignment strategy of datasets from TPFM, 3D-PLI, and dMRI implemented (T2.3.4); Datasets made available in the HBP human brain atlas

D9.3.1 PyNN 0.9 on SpiNNaker

As complete a PyNN 0.9 implementation on SpiNNaker as possible (Task 9.3.3)

D5.7.1 Representations of optical imaging data in the Neo data object model

This is a release of the Neo library that contains support for the representations of optical imaging data. This feature will facilitate the analysis of activity data obtained from optical imaging experiments using tools built on the Neo data model. Successful representation of a dataset in the Neo object model, and the subsequent application of an analysis function of the Elephant framework on that data object, will be shown (T5.7.1-2)

D4.3.1 All Models of Plasticity, Learning and Memory developed during SGA2

Presentation of all models developed by WP4.3 during the SGA2, including: functions and performance, validation (by SP4, by rest of the HBP and/or by third parties), how results compare to targeted impact, and links to models and related datasets in publicly accessible online repositories.

D4.5.1 All Whole-Brain Models developed during SGA2 and Comparison with Experiments

Presentation of all models developed by WP4.5 during the SGA2, including: functions and performance, validation (by SP4, by rest of the HBP and/or by third parties), how results compare to targeted impact, and links to models and related datasets in publicly accessible online repositories.

D2.1.1 Comparison of Deep-learning based cytoarchitectonic mapping of cortex in the big brain against gold standard cytoarchitectonic map

Deep-learning based cytoarchitectonic mapping of cortex in the big brain and comparison against gold standard cytoarchitectonic map (T2.1.4); map made available in the HBP human brain atlas

D8.5.3 Μedical Informatics Platform Releases - SOFTWARE & REPORT

Μedical Informatics Platform Releases - SOFTWARE & REPORT

D5.4.1 First release of software adapted to new Viewer Architecture

Coordinated release of several services related to atlas viewers, adapted to a more unified viewer infrastructure. The architecture of this unified viewer ecosystem will be specified by SP5 towards the end of SGA1 and become the basis for this work. (T5.4.3)

D12.4.1 Data Policy Manual

Having a set of data-related policies is a requirement for the HBP in order to: -Ensure that expectations with regards to data handling are clear -Comply with all data-related regulations and legislation, in particular those related to data protection -Ensure that all data registered and used in the HBP comply with ethical and other requirements -Demonstrate good management and leadership and implement good practice in data management Milestone verified by upload of the Data Policy Manual.

D1.6.2 SP1 Mouse Brain Organisation and Interspecies Comparisons - Second Data Results package (update on implementation of the DMP - M24)

WPs involved: WP1.1, WP1.2, WP1.3, WP1.4, WP1.5, and WP1.6 Contents: final report on the SP1 planned deliveries. This report will include the datasets generated in the SGA2 on whole brain and four major brain circuits (neocortex, cerebellum, basal ganglia, and hippocampus) data. This report will also include the final results on the integration of molecular, cellular and functional data (neocortex, cerebellum, basal ganglia, and hippocampus) and its application for modelling.

D7.2.1 Key technologies for fast data access and retrieval

This report summarises key technologies to support fast data access and retrieval for interactive analysis and visualisation, which have been identified and tested. This deliverable does not yet comprise the final implementation of these technologies.

D12.3.2 2nd Report SP12-SGA2: Lessons from stakeholder engagement and dialogue

The report collects up on the lessons learned from stakeholder dialogue and engagement in the Human Brain Project, from the ramp-up to the end of the SGA2 phase, and it develops foundation for stakeholder engagement in the final phases of the Human Brain Project.

D11.5.1 Fourth HBP Curriculum teaching cycle released (T11.5.2)

Third HBP Curriculum teaching cycle through online questionnaire evaluated and online courses adapted. Fourth teaching cycle started and Call for Expression of Interest for HBP Curriculum Workshops announced. Evaluation results are made available for consortium members and the public upon request. Call for Expression of Interest announced to the scientific community.

D5.10.1 CDP8 Results SGA2

CDP8 SGA2 Results Overview Deliverable: Overview of Key Results achieved in M1 to M24, tailored for presentation to the relevant audiences. WPs involved: WP5.10. Key results involved: KRc8.1, KRc8.2, KRc8.3. Use cases involved: SGA2-SP4-UC001, SGA2-SP5-UC001, SGA2-SP5-UC002, SGA2-SP6-UC001, SGA2-SP6-UC003, SGA2-SP7-UC001, SGA2-SP11-UC003. The report summarizes the results obtained during the project phase, which will involve: code for large-scale brain simulation on HBP’s Joint Platform; code for connectome extraction and integration of results into NIP ontology; interactive tutorials; preprocessed connectomes from major repositories; online version of von Economo and Koskinas atlas; linked connectivity to architectonic data; human connectivity predictions.

D7.5.1 HPAC Platform including CEA resources

D7.4.1 HBP Visualisation Software Catalogue

It contains semantic query functionality to support users in finding the right visualisation method and software for their specific needs.
